Package chess

Class Tour

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Tour
  • public class Tour
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that determines the moves a chess piece should make, such that it lands on every square of a board once.

    Constructor accepts a Board object and a Piece object. The tour compares both objects to determine which move to make. In this case, the next() method implements Warnsdorffâ€™s rule (albeit messily).

    Author:
    Johann von Tiesenhausen

    • Method Detail

      • startTour

        public void startTour​(Location loc)
        Moves the piece to starting location loc and marks all of the board locations as unvisited. Removes starting location, from unvisited locations.
        Parameters:
        loc - Starting Location of the Piece

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Checks if there is another move in the tour. Valid moves are unvisitied locations that exist on the board, which our piece can move to.

        For the Knight class, we can optimize this method by finding the intersection between the Knight's moveset and unvisited locations, but this is not feasible for other chess pieces (ex. Rook has infinite movement in the x/y direction).

        Returns:
        true if a valid move exists, false otherwise.

      • next

        public Location next()
        Finds the location where the piece should move from its current location), and moves the piece to that location. Uses Warnsdorffâ€™s rule.

        Warnsdorfs rule:

        1. find all the unvisited locations L_i that the knigth can reach in one move
        2. if there is no such location then the tour ends (either in failure, or the knight has visited every square of the board)
        3. for each location L_i found in Step 1:
          1. count the number N_i of unvisited locations that the knight can reach in one move from L_i
        4. the next move in the tour is the location L_i having the smallest non-zero count N_i
          1. if two or more locations L_i have the same minimum count then choose any one of those locations as the next move
        Returns:
        The location of the next move of the tour, or null if the piece cannot move to an unvisited location from its current location.

      • visited

        public java.util.Set<Location> visited()
        Get the locations that have been visited by our piece. Used for display purposes.
        Returns:
        set of visited locations
